2020-12-13T15:04:44Z: And that's all, folks! Thank you so much for following along with us this year; have a wonderful New Year, and in case we don't see you, good afternoon, good evening and goodnight.
2020-12-13T15:01:18Z: Here's the report from the final race of this year: F1 Abu Dhabi GP: Verstappen beats Mercedes duo to win 2020 finaleRed Bull's Max Verstappen dominated the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, winning ahead of Valtteri Bottas and Lewis Hamilton as Formula 1's 2020 season ended with a straightforward race
2020-12-13T14:59:57Z: That Abu Dhabi GP will go down in history as one of the many F1 races to have happened.
2020-12-13T14:55:21Z: Hamilton and Bottas indulge in donuts, celebrating a second and third in style.
2020-12-13T14:54:37Z: And that, ladies and gentlemen, is that for the year. Hindsight is officially 2020.
2020-12-13T14:53:05Z: Gasly, Ocon and Stroll complete the top 10.
2020-12-13T14:52:42Z: Norris and Sainz get fifth and sixth to surely secure third in the world constructors' championship, with Ricciardo snatching the fastest lap from Verstappen!
2020-12-13T14:52:11Z: Ocon mugs Stroll to take ninth place on the final lap as he charges up the inside on the run between Turns 10 and 11.
2020-12-13T14:51:28Z: Verstappen brings the season to a close with a lights-to-flag finish - leads every lap, gets the fastest lap, easy win, surely? Bottas and Hamilton keep second and third, as Albon got to 1.5s of Hamilton in his late charge.
2020-12-13T14:50:20Z: And Max Verstappen wins the 2020 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix!
2020-12-13T14:46:47Z: Fittipaldi is also hunting the fastest lap as Haas bolt on some softs for the final few laps. Verstappen still holds the fastest lap with a 1m40.958s.
2020-12-13T14:45:39Z: Albon was a full second faster than Hamilton on that lap. Does he have enough in the tank to go for third?
2020-12-13T14:44:52Z: Sainz has steadied the gap over Ricciardo to around 12 seconds so he looks to have sixth place safe - subject to a post-race penalty for his earlier pitlane incident - but as things stand McLaren has third place in the constructors' tied up.
2020-12-13T14:41:41Z: Magnussen pits for the second time in this race to take fresh mediums. Unless he had a puncture that looks like an unscheduled stop for the Danish driver - or maybe Haas want to give him a go at the fastest lap on his final race for the team.
2020-12-13T14:37:07Z: Hamilton is waving a few coveting glances at second place, having been slowly chipping away at Bottas. Verstappen, meanwhile, has scampered off into a 12s lead.
2020-12-13T14:36:50Z: Leclerc has been shown the black and white flag for exceeding track limits, so he'll have to be on his best behaviour between now and the end of the race to avoid a penalty.
2020-12-13T14:34:20Z: On lap 45 Ricciardo, on the fresh mediums, has taken 1.4s out of Sainz's advantage with the gap now at 14.6s, so the fight for sixth place could come alive over the final couple of laps.
2020-12-13T14:32:16Z: Verstappen reports vibrations, perhaps getting a bit under the collar. We've got 10 laps remaining - will anyone break the deadlock and come in for a stop?
2020-12-13T14:30:41Z: The quickest driver among the top four? It's currently Albon, who's whittling away at Hamilton now.
2020-12-13T14:29:43Z: Vettel on his new mediums makes light work of overtaking Russell at Turn 8 to take 14th place. 12 laps to go.
2020-12-13T14:28:13Z: Leclerc, still on his ascent up the order, tries to go around the outside of Raikkonen at Turn 11 but the Finn is having none of it and blocks the Ferrari driver into Turn 12 to keep hold of 12th.
2020-12-13T14:25:18Z: Ricciardo now finally, after 40 laps on those tyres, comes in to pit. He puts on a set of mediums, returning just ahead of Gasly to claim P7.
2020-12-13T14:23:44Z: Albon's set a couple of personal best laptimes to nibble away at Hamilton's advantage.
2020-12-13T14:22:16Z: Stroll, finally in clean air, has lost 8 seconds to Gasly having been stuck behind Vettel. Not the race the Racing Point driver had been hoping for.
2020-12-13T14:19:31Z: Vettel's red wall resistance against Stroll ends as he pits at the end of lap 36. The Ferrari driver takes on fresh mediums and comes out in P15 behind team-mate Leclerc and Russell in the Williams.
2020-12-13T14:18:48Z: No real action in the top three - Verstappen, Bottas and Hamilton all round about the same times. Albon's slowly starting to drop off Hamilton a bit.
2020-12-13T14:16:46Z: Leclerc picks off another one as he gets ahead of Russell at Turn 8 to take 14th place on lap 34. Further back Magnussen has pitted for the first time in this race and switches to the mediums - everyone else in this race is on the hards.
2020-12-13T14:13:30Z: Leclerc has been pinged for exceeding track limits at the final corner for, at least, the third time in this race. He's at risk of a penalty if he keeps doing that.
2020-12-13T14:11:46Z: Gasly shows Stroll how it is done as he dives up the inside of Vettel at Turn 8 to take eighth place. Vettel offers a fightback on the second stretch of back straight but the French driver sticks to the inside to keep the place.
2020-12-13T14:08:58Z: We're on lap 31, and Verstappen's now 7.5s clear of Bottas. Hamilton remains 2.4s behind his team-mate, with Albon 6s adrift. Ricciardo's 17.5s off the top four.
2020-12-13T14:08:05Z: Stroll, still stuck behind Vettel, is caught napping by Gasly as the AlphaTauri driver sends it up the inside at Turn 11 to take ninth place.
2020-12-13T14:05:03Z: Leclerc and his fresh hard tyres is making quick work of climbing back up the order having already overtaken Fittipaldi, Latifi and Magnussen. Giovinazzi pits ahead of him to hand the Ferrari driver P15.
2020-12-13T14:03:00Z: Sainz's pit incident - going too slowly in the pitlane - will be investigated after the race. That adds an extra post-race dimension to the battle for P3 in the constructors.
2020-12-13T14:01:22Z: Stroll, closing in on Vettel, locks up at Turn 11 and runs wide. That's cost him a couple of seconds and really not what Racing Point needed.
2020-12-13T13:59:47Z: Russell is up to 14th having got ahead of Giovinazzi, who is yet to stop in this race, and the Williams driver is now chasing down Raikkonen.
2020-12-13T13:57:35Z: Hamilton's just trying to reel Bottas in, asking about his team-mate's current situation. The seven-time champion wants to try something different, but Albon's keeping Mercedes honest just 5s behind.
2020-12-13T13:56:18Z: Leclerc is duly allowed to pit by Ferrari on lap 23, dropping him to last place.
2020-12-13T13:51:49Z: A lap later Gasly also gets ahead of Leclerc, diving up the inside of the Ferrari driver at Turn 8, to take 10th place.
2020-12-13T13:51:03Z: At least, Norris HAD got back within DRS range - but Ricciardo's found something extra to crowbar open the gap again. As you were.
2020-12-13T13:50:40Z: Stroll answers the call as he gets ahead of Leclerc around the outside before braking for Turn 8 and ensures the move sticks by defending into Turn 11.
2020-12-13T13:49:04Z: Stroll is still stuck behind Leclerc in ninth place and now has Gasly directly behind him. Racing Point will be desperate for their driver to clear the Ferrari if it is to keep hold of third place in the constructors' standings.
2020-12-13T13:46:35Z: Sainz has been placed under investigation for driving unnecessarily slowly in the pitlane during the safety car period. Not that it is bothering the McLaren driver at the moment as he gets by Vettel for seventh at Turn 11.
2020-12-13T13:45:16Z: Verstappen's now 2.4s clear of Bottas at the front. Hamilton's a further 1.8s behind.
2020-12-13T13:44:56Z: Not pitting under the safety car looks like it is hurting Leclerc as Stroll charges by at Turn 8 - only for Leclerc to repay the favour with the aid of DRS between Turns 10 and 11. As you were.
2020-12-13T13:42:10Z: Verstappen's comfortable on these tyres, setting a 1m40.958s as he crosses the line to start lap 15.
2020-12-13T13:41:13Z: Sainz gets the best restart as he charges ahead of future Ferrari team-mate Leclerc at Turn 8 to move up to eighth place.
2020-12-13T13:40:00Z: Here we go again! Verstappen takes off to get us back underway.
2020-12-13T13:38:26Z: Safety car will come in at the end of the lap.
2020-12-13T13:37:18Z: The only drivers not to pit during this safety car period are Ricciardo (P5), Vettel (P7), Leclerc (P8), Giovinazzi (P12) and Magnussen (P15).
2020-12-13T13:35:03Z: Amid the stops, Ricciardo gets up to fifth, as Vettel and Leclerc are up to seventh and eighth having elected not to pit.
2020-12-13T13:34:19Z: Now it is a full safety car with the marshals struggling to get Perez's car safely off the side of the track. There's also reports of oil on track.
2020-12-13T13:33:11Z: Verstappen takes the opportunity to pit for fresh boots. Mercedes follows suit - all three go to the hard tyres, as does Albon.
2020-12-13T13:31:59Z: Oh no heartbreak for Perez! His engine gives up on lap 10 which forces him to pull out of the race, which has triggered a Virtual Safety Car period.
2020-12-13T13:30:48Z: Two Racing Point overtakes on the same lap at the same corner! On lap eight Stroll dives to the inside of Kvyat at Turn 8 to take 7th, and then Perez copies the move to get ahead of Raikkonen for 14th.
2020-12-13T13:30:43Z: Two Racing Point overtakes on the same lap at the same corner! On lap eight Stroll dives to the inside of Kvyat at Turn 8 to take 7th, and then Perez copies the move to get ahead of Raikkonen for 14th.
2020-12-13T13:30:25Z: Perez watch: He's up to 15th on lap eight having moved ahead of Russell and Giovinazzi. The Mexican is on the charge once again.
2020-12-13T13:25:36Z: Ocon doesn't have a chance to use said pace as it looks like Renault have ordered a switcheroo as Ricciardo is unleashed into 10th place. The Australian is on the hards and Ocon is on the mediums, for reference.
2020-12-13T13:24:55Z: Nice move from Albon, gets the DRS on the first back straight and clears Norris. Norris gets back at him on the second stretch, but Albon brakes latest and claims fourth.
2020-12-13T13:23:51Z: DRS isn't looking massively effective at the moment. Perhaps that'll change with tyre wear as we get into the race, but the majority are just trying to get to a one-stop window.
2020-12-13T13:21:20Z: Perez, aiming to go long on the hards for his opening stint, is up to 17th place at the start of lap five having overtaken Latifi, Fittipaldi and Magnussen on consecutive laps.
2020-12-13T13:18:52Z: Ocon keeps ninth place for just a lap as Gasly dives back ahead under braking at Turn 11. For everyone else it is as you were, this track is known to be tricky for overtaking after all.
2020-12-13T13:18:36Z: It's a 1m42.292s for Verstappen on that lap, and actually, he's now two seconds clear.
2020-12-13T13:18:03Z: Verstappen already has the hammer down, opening up a 1.8s gap over Bottas.
2020-12-13T13:16:32Z: Strong start from Magnussen to go from last place to 17th - the biggest climber on the first lap - with the Ferrari drivers and Alfa Romeo drivers swapping places in the running order. Ocon has also jumped up to ninth ahead of Gasly.
2020-12-13T13:15:27Z: Verstappen sweeps across and keeps the lead, as Bottas keeps second! Albon is having a go at Norris - and it's been a clean start for everyone.
2020-12-13T13:14:20Z: And for the final time this year, we're away!
2020-12-13T13:08:46Z: There's a track temperature of 30 degrees C, air temp at 23.4 degrees and falling - as day becomes night.
2020-12-13T13:07:59Z: Tyre news: Norris, Albon, Kvyat, Stroll and Gasly on softs. Ricciardo, Vettel, Perez and Magnussen on hards. Everyone else on mediums.
2020-12-13T13:06:31Z: Unless you have it on your Spotify playlists, here's the last rendition of F1's theme song for this year.
2020-12-13T13:01:33Z: So, Verstappen on pole. Can he hold off the Mercedes pair? Will Bottas and Hamilton charge forward? And can Norris play some part in the frontguard action? We can but wait.
2020-12-13T12:48:51Z: Just the small matter of an F1 race before we can all sign off for the year, hibernate and ponder the bigger questions, such as: will Albon stay at Red Bull? Will Tsunoda get the AlphaTauri drive? And what on earth do I get my dad for Christmas?
2020-12-13T12:47:14Z: A lot of finality around this last round of the season. Plenty of drivers are due to move teams over the off-season, and other movements due between 2020 and 2021. But we promise we won't get too soppy about it.
2020-12-13T12:40:25Z: The cancelled race in Australia seems like a lifetime ago, and it seemed like a lifetime between that and the eventual Red Bull Ring season opener. It's been a long ol' year.
2020-12-13T12:38:45Z: In the space of five-and-a-half months, F1 has run 16 races in a much-interrupted 2020 calendar. Now, in just 30 minutes' time, we'll have the 17th and last race of the season. Hello everyone, and welcome to the last Autosport Live of the season.
